result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay out of prison monies.
All other costs remitted.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample today.
Pay DNA surcharge out of prison monies.
No possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs or any other controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.

During extended supervision, once every month, defendant to talk to middle school students (12-13 year olds) regarding how marijuana and alcohol affected his life; as supervised by agent.
Assessments, counseling and follow through as determined by agent.
If available when released to extended supervision, defendant to participate in a Drug Court Program as alternative to extended supervision.
